intro: Clinopodium micranthum f. albiflorum, commonly known as whiteflower wild thyme, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, and it produces small, oblong berries that contain the seeds. This variety is often found in grassy areas and rocky habitats across Europe and parts of Asia.
